Commenting on these changes, Eric Schmidt said: We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come. Larry said:`` Eric Schmidt has clearly done an outstanding job leading Google Inc. for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. In a rare concession, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld said in an interview with Diane Sawyer on`` Nightline'' that he should have stepped down following Abu Ghraib. That was such a stain on our country; to think that people in our custody were treated in that disgusting and perverted and ghastly way, unacceptable way, he said.`` There wasn't an easy target. At the 2009 G-20 summit in Pittsburgh, Google chief executive Eric Schmidt suggested that multiplayer games could provide positive opportunities for improving business training and enhancing workplace collaboration. Speaking at a forum session, Eric Schmidt said: The game world is good training for a career in tech. It teaches players to build a network, to use interactive skills and thinking. Everything in the future online is going to look like a multiplayer game. If I were 15 years old, that's what I would be doing right now. Games appeal to people's natural competitive instinct, creating a sense of frustration and reward that increases engagement with the task at hand.
